intro: Tithymalus granulatus, commonly known as the granulated tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Native to regions of southern Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. The plant's aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and natural landscapes.
